content:
Jerome Quenum is an Electrical Engineering Ph.D. student at UC Berkeley. His research interests include Signal Processing, Machine Learning, and Computer Vision. He is affiliated with the Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research (BAIR) Lab and is advised by Prof. Zakhor.
Previously, Quenum attended the University of Maryland, College Park where he was awarded the University Medal. Throughout his journey, he has participated in various academic research programs and many outreach community volunteering initiatives.
Quenum has served in automated logistics before serving currently as a signal officer in the U.S. Army.
summary:
Jerome Quenum is an Electrical Engineering Ph.D. student at UC Berkeley. His research interests include Signal Processing, Machine Learning, and Computer Vision. He is affiliated with the Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research (BAIR) Lab and is advised by Prof. Zakhor.
Previously, Quenum attended the University of Maryland, College Park where he was awarded the University Medal. Throughout his journey, he has participated in various academic research programs and many outreach community volunteering initiatives.
title: Jerome Quenum

content:
• Designed and implemented Facial Recognition / Facial Expression Recognition classifiers using Machine Learning Algorithms (KNN, SVM, Naïve Bayes … etc) with Dr. Babadi.
• Implemented Spectral Clustering and K-means Algorithms on various data set.
• Worked on implementing real time American Sign Language (ASL) Recognition system with classmates and Dr. Wilson.
• Implemented multiclass SVM classifiers and DNN/CNN classifiers on MNIST data set.
summary: These past projects involve the design and implementation of various classification schemes
title: Machine Learning / Deep Learning / CNN / DNN

content:
• Designed and implemented Semiconductor Device Fabrication methods for Integrated Circuits (ICs) with Dr. Daniels.
• Designed and constructed an automatic mini solar tracker with Dr. Mogren.
summary: These past projects involve the design and fabrication schemes for integrated circuits (ICs)
title: Microelectronics / Device Fabrication

content:
• Designed a module allowing to use Cell phones as a remote to control and monitor houses and cars using Pic Basic microcontroller.
• Studied the Energy approach of the raindrop problem (Lagrangian Approach) with Dr. Li.
summary: These past projects involve the Lagrangian approach of the rain drop problem and the design of cellular remote control system.
title: Physics and Telecoms

content:
• Designed and implemented FIR, IIR, Notch Filters… etc for Audio signal processing (Denoising) with Dr. Liu.
• Designed and implemented Image Compression algorithms for Signal Processing (Quantization table and DCT) with Dr. Liu.
summary: These past projects involve the implementation of various filters for image, audio, speech and video processing.
title: Signal Processing
